events.title: â€˜I just want to stop hearing about itâ€™: a weary South Korea awaits verdict on Yoon insurrection charges

When Yoon stands in courtroom 417 of Seoul central district court on Thursday to hear his fate, which will be broadcast live, he will do so in the same room where the military dictator Chun Doo-hwan was sentenced to death three decades ago. The charge is formally the same. Last time, it took almost 17 years and a democratic transition to deliver a verdict. This time, it has taken 14 months. events.description: On the day that her memoir is published, GisÃ¨le Pelicot has again spoken of her desire to meet and talk with her ex-husband, who repeatedly drugged her and invited strangers over to their house to rape her. Pelicot's book "A Hymn to Life" covers the full arc of her story, including the trial she went through. In Perspective, we spoke to one of the journalists who has covered her story throughout: Catherine Porter, who is Paris correspondent for The New York Times. She says she knew before she first went to court that the story would resonate across France, but that Pelicot's decision to waive her anonymity really opened the door to her trial having an impact worldwide.

events.title: Michael Jordan's 1998 NBA Finals sneakers sell for a record $2.2 million
events.description: In 1998, Michael Jordan laced up a pair of his iconic black and red Air Jordan 13s to bring home a Bulls victory during Game 2 of his final NBA championship â€” and now they are the most expensive sneakers ever to sell at auction. The game-winning sneakers sold for $2.2 million at Sotheby's in New York on Tuesday, smashing the sneaker auction record of $1.47 million, set in 2021 by a pair of Nike Air Ships that Jordan wore earlier in his career.

events.title: Here's the real reason to turn on airplane mode when you fly
events.description: We all know the routine by heart: "Please ensure your seats are in the upright position, tray tables stowed, window shades are up, laptops are stored in the overhead bins and electronic devices are set to flight mode."

events.title: DHS shuts down after a funding lapse. And, why athletes get the 'yips' at the Olympics
events.description: Congress is out on recess as a partial shutdown at the Department of Homeland Security is underway. And, why some superstar athletes have been getting the "yips" at the Winter Olympics in Italy.

events.title: Book by mass rape survivor Gisele Pelicot tells her story
events.description: She refuses to be a victim: Having survived years of assaults orchestrated by her husband while she was drugged unconscious, Pelicot chronicles in "A Hymn to Life" her path back to life.

events.title: Spain to investigate big tech over AI child abuse imagery
events.description: Spain is set to investigate X, Meta and TikTok for allegedly spreading AI-generated child abuse material. The move comes as European nations tighten controls to regulate social media platforms.

events.title: Germany inflation rises 2.1% at start of 2026
events.description: Increases in food and fuel prices were the main drivers of inflation in Germany, new statistics confirmed.

events.title: US civil rights leader Jesse Jackson dies at 84
events.description: Prominent Baptist minister and longtime figure in the US civil rights movement Jesse Jackson has died. Jackson became a political force after working closely with Martin Luther King Jr. and running for president.

events.title: Germany news: Government mulls social media ban for children
events.description: Germany is joining the list of nations considering a ban on social media for children, with both coalition partners drawing up plans. Meanwhile, figures show German industry cut around 124,000 jobs in 2025. DW has more.

events.title: Follow live: Macron, Modi hold joint press event in Mumbai on AI and defence
events.description: French President Emmanuel Macron holds a joint press event with Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Mumbai on Tuesday during his three-day visit focused on artificial intelligence cooperation, defence deals and strengthening strategic ties. Follow FRANCE 24's live coverage.

events.title: Producer of hit TV spy thriller found dead in hotel room
events.description: The executive producer of hit TV spy thriller Tehran has been found dead in an Athens hotel, police have said.

events.title: Imran Khan's doctor not allowed to treat him in jail, spokesman claims
events.description: Former Pakistani prime minister Imran Khan has not received adequate medical treatment in prison after suffering partial vision loss in one eye, his spokesman claims.
